titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mike Frost graphic designer collection of Houston Hip-Hop artwork, 1999-2009 MS 682
titlestmt.author: Amanda Focke

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-06 11:29:21 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Mike Frost graphic designer collection of Houston Hip-Hop artwork
did.abstract: Examples of graphic design work done by Mike Frost for hip-hop artists in the Houston area.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: With over 15 years experience as both a Graphic Designer and Photographer, Mike Frost has defined the image and branding of rap/hip-hop albums in Texas an arguably the South. He started out designing event fliers in the Punk and electronic music communities of Houston in the mid 90s. Shortly after learning one of the first releases of Adobe's Photoshop, many of his friends started pursuing their music careers. Most notable were; Mike Jones, Chamillionaire, Paul Wall, Devin the Dude, Slim Thug, Z-Ro, and Trae. With Mike, Cham, and Paul certifying platinum and Cham's Grammy, Frost's position as the go to man for graphic design, web development, and photography was solidified. He is currently Creative Director for Swisha House and his own boutique creative agency, SLFEMP. He created SLFEMP as a means to bring multifaceted and talented artists together to collaborate on album packaging, press, commercial, web development, and fine-art projects. His most recent Credits include: Slim Thug The Boss of all Bosses, Paul Wall The Fast Life, and photography and design for Microsoft's Zune advertisements featuring Common. (excerpted from SLFEMP "About" page Facebook, https://www.facebook.com/pg/SLFEMP713/about/, accessed March 17, 2017)
See online video on Mike Frost's career path in graphic design, at https://youtu.be/dL1urXoHvvU. Guest appearances are: G Dash, ESG, Slim Thug, Mike Frost, Brandon Holley.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Examples of graphic design work done by Mike Frost for hip-hop artists in the Houston area.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.
Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mike Frost graphic designer collection of Houston Hip-Hop artwork, 1999-2009, MS 682, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be facilitated through the Woodson Research Center.

did.unittitle: Series I: T-shirts
1 Paul Wall East Life t-shirt, green cotton with white lettering
Series II: Magazines
Envy magazine / Houston life, March #26 featuring Paul Wall on cover (year unclear)
Rap Illustrated V.4 2004 featuring Z-RO on the cover
Rap Illustrated V.2 2003 featuring TRAE of the G-Maab on cover
Hustlenomics 3rd edition 2007 featuring SwishaHouse artists on the cover
Ozone Magazine 3rd annual Ozone Awards (date?)
Texas Music Winter 2006 Issue 25 featuring Mike Jones on the cover
Houston Press issue - Slim Thug on cover, April 2-8, 2009
Houston Press issue - Pimp C on cover Dec 13-19, 2007
Series III: Flyers, flats and one-sheets
Two 8.5x11" one sheets (Lone Star Ridaz)
2 one sheets for distributors (Baby Beesh: On Tha Cool; and Twin Beredaz)

Thirteen small flyers, including 2 microphone shaped SwishaHouse All Freestyles 4; Yuckmouth; Kickdoor Bandits; Z-RO; Kamakazeez; SwishaHouse Christmas Festival; Mista Da Masta; Big Tiger of da Swishahouse; SK Comin' All Day
Five 12x12" flats: Something to Lean To; On tha Cool; Lil O; Sir Daily and Doodie; Z-RO
6" x 18" Guerilla Maab = Res - Ur - Rect - Ed, featuring Dougie D, Trae and Z-RO; KMJ Records
Series IV: Posters
Poster: PSK-12 & Michael "5000" Watts - Something to Lean To - Chopped and Skrewed - Nightshift Muzik, Houston, TX
Poster: Michael Watts & Lil Mario presents - Lil Mario's Street Fame - Swisha House Records
Poster: Dope House Records / South Park Mexican - Reveille Park - Houston, TX
Poster: Screwston Vol. III - Stuck in Da Mud - Dope House Records - Houston, TX
Poster: Big Pic of Da Swishahouse - Certified
Fat Texas Records presents Texas Made: featuring Big Tee, 3-2 The Governor, J-Duce, Tony Montana, Lil' Sen "Gotti", Relentless Mafia, Villian Keys, Icey Hott & KB the Kidnappa
Poster: Lil' O - Food on tha Table; Game Face Ent. Houston, TX
Poster: 20-2-Life, Featuring C-Loc, Boo, PSK-13, Lil Keke, Mista Madd, Point Blank, The Cellmates / Inmate Records

Poster: Klas' One - The One and Only / Mixed chopped and screwed by Swisha House Michael "5000" Watts, Featuring Slim Thug, Papareu, Kamakazeez, Boonie Locc, Lil Mario, J-Dawg, A.D., 50-50, Doodie, Ghost Lansky, Agonylife, Yung Skrilla
Poster: Michael Watts Presents Mista Da Masta, Chooped Up Remix, Archie Lee of da Swishahouse
Poster: Lone Star Ridaz - 40 Days 40 nights
Poster: I-45 - Lost Between the Lines, Fuzzgun Records, 2000 ( 2 copies)
Poster: Z-RO, ca. 2004
Poster: double sided featuring Juan Gotti / No Set Trippin; Baby Beesh On Tha Cool; Twin Beredaz

Poster: SwishaHouse All Freestyles 4, featuring Michael Watts, Chamillionaire, Sabwarfare, Lester Roy, Blyndcyde, Slim Thug, Lil Mario, Bag Tiger, Al Bolden, Paul Wall, Lil Ron, J-Dawg, Big Pic, Lil Flip, 50/50, Ron C., A.D.

Poster: Freestyles Mixed Screwed and Chopped, DJ Marco Polo, Syrup Factory, Vol 2, Coming Fall 2001. Featuring Dooney, Lil Keke, Big Mor of Wreckshop, Slim Thug, 3-2 of the Screwed Up, Click, Icey Hott of Street Military, .50 Cal, D-Yates, Ghetto, Bandit, K-Fiend, J-Boy, Project 8, Joker, Coliaon, Candyman, Young J, Ace, LaLa & The Syrup, Factory Click
Poster: SwishaHouse Presents Big Tiger
Poster: Sixth Annual Carmona Custom Car Show and Concert, Memorial Day Sunday, May 27, 2001, Houston TX (double-sided)
Series V: Digital artwork organized by artist
Chamillionaire
